intro: Thapsia edulis, commonly known as the edible thapsia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and compound umbels of small white or yellowish flowers. The plant is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in dry, rocky soils. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. Thapsia edulis is sometimes cultivated for its edible leaves and seeds, which are used in traditional cuisine.
